bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dan La Botz (1945- ) was the Socialist Party of Ohio's 2010 candidate for the U.S. Senate.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains material relating to La Botz's 2010 Socialist Party campain for Ohio U.S. Senate. The materials include correspondence (with voters, government bodies, the mass media, other (progressive organizations, etc.), a campaign diary, handwritten notes, materials relating to a compliant filed with the FCC (Federal Communications Commission), campaign literature and related printed ephemera, a book-length typescript "A Vision from the Heartland: Socialism for the 21st Century," and two DVDs containing television appearances and other events.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated by Dan La Botz in 2011. An addition of seven folders relating to his 2010 U.S. Senate campaign were donated in 2013. The accession number associated with this gift is 2013.031.
